isis.stitle: DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM ANCHORLOK SPRING BRAKE - GENERAL SERVICE INSTRUCTIONS

warning.para: A spring brake contains a very powerful compression spring. Failure to comply with all of the following instructions may result in forceful release of the double diaphragm Anchorlok spring chamber and its contents which could cause death, severe personal injury and/or property damage.

step1.para: Always block wheels to prevent vehicle rollaway when replacing or servicing the Anchorlok Double Diaphragm spring brake assembly.

warning.para: The spring brake chamber portion of the assembly has been sealed for your protection. There are no user-serviceable parts inside the spring brake chamber. If you experience damage or failure of the spring brake chamber, remove and discard it as outlined in this service section. Never attempt to disassemble the spring brake chamber as serious personal injury, death and/or property damage could result from accidental sudden release of the powerful compression spring.

step1.para: Never strike any part of the spring brake with a hammer or any other heavy object; structural damage may result.
Do not drop the spring brake as the jar may release the spring brake.

warning.para: To prevent severe personal injury when removing an uncaged spring brake from a vehicle, cut the service push rod with an acetylene cutting torch, making sure to relieve all force on it. After cutting the push rod, remove the spring brake from the vehicle, then disarm the spring brake. Refer to SAFETY CHAMBER.

step1.para: If air pressure is used to aid in the caging process, do not tighten release tool nut more than finger tight. The air pressure must always be exhausted after the power spring has been caged, prior to any disassembly.
On a Gold Seal double diaphragm Anchorlok assembly, the spring brake diaphragm cannot be replaced. Replace the complete spring brake chamber.
